modules.description: The module provides reactive programming primitives for managing stateful values that evolve through discrete changes, using a type `('a, 'da) t` to represent values (`'a`) paired with their differential updates (`'da`). Core operations include event-driven signal creation, combining signals via lifting functions with custom update logic, and sequencing computations over changing values using `bind`, alongside utilities for initializing and dynamically updating tuples and lists of signals with patch functions. This supports use cases like real-time state management, event stream processing, and interactive systems where values must track and propagate changes over time.
